definition: clean/completely/only/net (income, exports etc)/(Chinese opera) painted face male role
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Hotel net revenue was $52.1 million in the second quarter 2010, up 13 percent (nine percent on a constant currency basis) year over year.
sentences.chinese: 酒店淨收入爲5210萬美元，同比上升了13%。

sentences.english: Net sales revenue minus the cost of goods sold.
sentences.chinese: 毛利是銷售淨收入減去已銷商品成本。

sentences.english: So-called organic net revenue, which excludes the effect of acquisitions and disposals, grew 2 percent.
sentences.chinese: 不包括併購和出售在內，該公司有機淨收入增長2%。

sentences.english: Higher transaction volume partially offset the decline in net revenue per transaction.
sentences.chinese: 酒店交易量的提升部分抵消了每交易淨收入的下滑。

sentences.english: Intel's net income dropped 25 percent to 2 billion dollars.
sentences.chinese: 因特爾的淨收入下降了25%，只有20億美元。

definition: (computing) transcoding/to convert (from one encoding to another)
remittance/funds paid to a bank account
